name: Transportation Geography
description: Transportation systems play a fundamental role in shaping social, economic and environmental outcomes in a region. This course explores geographical perspectives on the development and functioning of transportation systems, interactions between transportation and land use, and costs and benefits associated with transportation systems including: mobility, accessibility, congestion, pollution, and livability.Area of focus: Urban Geography
prerequisites: Any 8.0 credits including GGRA30H3 and [GGRB05H3 or CITB02H3]
